The BK is built on top of the UMLS and represents medical terms using factual statements that associate the term with labels and semantic types. Since for the same medical term, different organizations may have assigned different labels to the term, BK keeps track of the number of duplicate labels and ranks the labels per term based on this number ; we call this number the linking score of the labels of a term. Given an entity e, the MEL component searches on BK, the potential terms from UMLS that will be part of te. To increase confidence in the correctness of the terms in te, the MEL component follows a heuristic-based approach, which assumes that the labels with the highest values of the linking score are the most appropriate labels for e.
